intro: Linaria cymbalaria, commonly known as the common sandwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing herbaceous plant that typically reaches a height of 10–30 cm. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. Linaria cymbalaria is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
